Reviews.Title: “Good for conferences and stopovers”
Reviews.Author: batravn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in connection to a wedding. The hotel is a quite typical conference hotel placed near the Dadeland Mall, and close to restaurants in a quite newly build district. Further the access from US1 and the Turnpike is very easy. Book this hotel for easy access to the Florida Keys or the Everglades, but not the beaches of Miami Beach. The reception staff was pleasant and professional and the valet service was quick. The rooms are of a good size, clean and with good beds. Nothing special in respect to decor. Free wifi is always a plus in my book. We are right in the middle of a 3 or 4 star rating, but with only 4 elevators the waiting time could be quite long, and at an ordinary rate I would only rate it a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service..Carpet was gross”
Reviews.Author: Outdoorguy2
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in the hotel recently. Service was super friendly and efficient. The room was clean except that the carpets were just nasty. I did not want to step on them. Free shuttle from the airport was good. Saved me $40.00.

Reviews.Title: “Service makes up for some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Adam K
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Marriott Dadeland attending a meeting. Marriotts are generally solid hotels. The lobby and bar are fairly upscale so one would expect a room with a modern plush top hotel bed but this was not the case. The mattress was hard and I mentioned that to the management. Making up for this was an excellent pool area and gym. The front desk were extremely pleasant and one bought me a Cuban dish I was craving when the restaurant she directed me to did not serve that dish. That kind of service went way beyond expectation. The only thing keeping this from being a perfect hotel is a comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “For serious shoppers. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Quilhunter
Reviews.Content: In front of the Dadeland Mall. 10 minutes away of The Falls. Easy access to the 826.Good balance between price and location. Still one of my favorites in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: grettontraveller
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, room was spacious clean and comfortable with bright attractive decor and fab flat screen tv.Wifi in room.Gym was very good for a hotel and pool area was lovely although overlooked by office buildings.Close to mall/shops.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location... best beds and pillows in the business”
Reviews.Author: Angie S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least ten times this year and a few times a year for the past 8 years or so. I love the proximitely to the mall and the expressway. As a business traveler it's very convenient in case of forgotten items. Not to mention the closest "store" to the enterance is the Cheese Cake Factory and you can't go wrong there. Back to the hotel, great facility for business or pleasure. Comfortable oversized rooms with beds and pillows that will keep you down for too many snooze sessions. I always feel like a welcomed guest at the front desk, very quick but still friendly and accomodating. I've never had an issue here with the internet connection as I have in other chains. I should mention also the pool deck on the 7th floor is a very nice outdoor space. The gym is also up here and provides a nice view of the pool while you're working out.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: pfl0res
Reviews.Content: we went to do some shopping and sightseeing in Miami, the hotel is very comfortable, walking distance to the dadeland mall, the room was renew, the bed and pillows were so good, breakfast is very good, people were friendly, if i come back again, certanly i will come back

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kitalki
Reviews.Content: In walking distance to dadeland mall. Great location! Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott”
Reviews.Author: 747traveller
Reviews.Content: Strange wood panelled lobby but comfortable rooms good breakfast on the second floor, adequate pool area and well equipped gym. Good location for Mall shopping

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs an update”
Reviews.Author: Dominic1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in september for a conference. The hotel rooms feel old, they need an update, the food for the conference was average. Staff was nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “rooms a little tired but ok otherwise”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: The location is good if you want to shop at the nearby mall or use the commuter train to downtown Miami. Rooms a little dated ie. old style tv but more spacious than other Marriots that I have stayed in. Bathroom small. Bed good. This hotel is fine for business but I would not recommend for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Okay....”
Reviews.Author: MatthewD713
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight on a business trip. The hotel is outdated, just like most full service Marriotts. The Courtyards, and other sub categories are actually nicer hotels. Bathrooms very small and again outdated. Bed standard. View was the best part of the place. If I have my say I'll stay somewhere else next time. I'd suggest the same to you. Front desk was helpful and pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had stayed at the Holliday Inn instead.”
Reviews.Author: pwill144
Reviews.Content: We were there parts of three days and the room never got serviced. The maid came the first morning after our stay and we were still sleep so I asked her to come back. We were out of the room by 11:00 am. We got back late that night and nothing had been touchedâ€¦not even the tip we had left on the dresser. So, we asked for more towels and went to bed. We checked out the next day. The location was close to the Dadeland Mall which we visited. The only reason we stayed there was because of its close proximity to our kidâ€™s location (we donâ€™t like to pile in on top of them when we visit). The hotel offered to give me 500 reward points for the inconvenienceâ€¦ which have never showed up. So, all things being considered, this Marriott will never see my money again. Oh, I forgot, they were going to charge me a 50% percent increase in my rate on the last day of our scheduled stay because of occupancy rates. We found a five star hotel up in Ft. Lauderdale close to the beach and the airport for less than what these clowns were wanting to charge me. Try the â€œWâ€� hotel in Ft. Lauderdale if you want to be Wowed!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: marajoe
Reviews.Content: We were here for a business meeting. Good food and a nice pool. We did drive to south beach, but it was a bit of a drive.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, below MarriottÂ´s standards.”
Reviews.Author: JORGEUruguay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marriott Dadeland for a business meeting and what I really enjoyed most was staying in my room. The hotel has a large but complicated infrastructure that makes not very simple to find either a meeting room or the deli express store. The room is comfortable enough for a business stay, with free wifi . If you want to have an espresso during the day you may probably have difficulties to find one: the lobby bar has no coffee machine . Food is nothing special here. However, the staff , and specially the service personnel at the restaurant on 2nd floor, is nice and competent. Dadeland is not close to the most relevant attractions in Miami (Downtown, Ocean Drive and South Beach, Bayside) , but this Marriott has the Dadeland Mall just two blocks far from the hotel entrance if you want good shopping with prices in the middle of Aventura Mall and Outlets. In summary, nothing special if used to MarriottÂ´s standards.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Room! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGraemekidd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Mariott over night the room payed by my company. Great staff,very friendly. Good breakfast & free wifi. The room was dated and the carpet was filthy. Bed ok & did have a flat screen tv. The pool area is nice and the hotels gym is good. The rooms I feel let this hotel down. Supermarket 2 minute walk away & all the usual shops and a mall within walking distance. Didn't have room service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueWater42
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for two nights in room 1002 (ten o' two) and was pleasantly surprised. Got in very late and all the restaurants were closed, but was still able to order room service until 11pm. The breakfast buffet is roughly $16 and is really quality...wish I had more to eat there again. I didn't explore too much around the area, but did find good BBQ right around the block at Shorty's BBQ. Would def stay again and highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and comfy, but stay away from the restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: The_Arden
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I'm surprised by some of the comments I've seen on this site. The room I had was very clean and comfortable. I didn't see any dirt and I did indeed have a flatscreen TV, though I didn't use it. The beds were great, and I can't complain about the decor. If I was being picky, then yes, the yellow chair in the corner could probably use replacing, and perhaps so could the curtains, but other than that, it looks great. The staff here is extremely friendly and very helpful and seem to go out of their way to please. The only major complaint that I have is that the food at Whitney's, their restaurant, is barely passable. I had many buffet breakfasts there, and although the fruit is great, everything else was not worth eating. The bacon and sausages were barely warm, the pancakes, waffles were dry and the eggs just ok. I made the mistake of going there for dinner. While waiting 40 minutes for my meal, I had the pleasure of enjoying toast in the place of dinner rolls for bread. Toast. The meal was fine, though the pork chop I had was slightly overcooked and dry, but still tasted ok, though nothing special. For the price I paid, it should have been a lot better. I can't comment on the other facilities because I didn't have time to use them, nor can I comment on the location since I didn't have much time to wander around. I can say however that there is a fairly nice mall nearby, a few restaurants and a Publix. As for other attractions, Bayside is nearby, but I'm ignorant of anything else.

Reviews.Title: “This place needs a professional cleaning!! Kinda disappointed in Marriott!!!”
Reviews.Author: AtlButtrfly
Reviews.Content: The customer service was great!! Location was good for a quick one night stay!! Everyone was friendly and willing to help!! Valet was extremely efficient. But in the other hand. They need to pay a professional service to come clean this place. The remote in the room was so filthy I watched espn the whole night. I had to wash my hands after touching it. The bed was super comfy. One pillow had a stain and we caught housekeeping in the hallway to change it with no problem. The way looks like someone threw mustard on it. The bathroom only had one set of bath towels, which housekeeping replace happily. So I can't say this place is horrible, but I think they need to invest in having someone clean the walls, remotes, and base boards in the hotel. I wouldn't stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Oli-Ben-Zani
Reviews.Content: I selected hotel because website indicated that the hotel wa recently renovated. By recent it appears that Marriott meant the 70's. Hotel was dirty and service was terrible. Had to wait over 45 minutes for an order of salad at the hotel bar. Wait staff was completely unconcerned about delay. Also, when checking out, individual at front desk was on phone and refused to engage me in conversation. I will never go back to this hotel. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had at a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “No Flat TV?”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: The Hotel does not have flat TV in rooms.. Holes in Room Curtain Carpet looks dirty... Hotel in general looks outdated...

Reviews.Title: “Everything an Aircrew member needs!”
Reviews.Author: autigers5252
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel and honestly wish I could have stayed longer. The location is convenient for military aircrew members due to the close proximity of several restaurants and a Publix grocery store. The rooms were spacious with outstanding beds. The pool and fitness area were superb. On the second floor of the hotel is a restaurant called Whitney's that serves and amazing breakfast and has a great wait staff. The front desk personnel were great and very understanding of our frequent last minute requests for room extensions and late checkouts. Parking is provided on site for 19 dollars a day. There are several Ballrooms and meeting spaces at this hotel so there is always something happening near the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice staff, great pool!! We'd love to come back!”
Reviews.Author: airforcewife04
Reviews.Content: I must of looked at every hotel in Miami, & was even a little worried after we booked this based on other reviews. Well, I was put at ease as soon as we arrived. The staff was great, very, very, friendly. I loved the bell-hop service & the valet parking after a long trip with 2 tired kids along with us. We stayed on the 20th floor it had a great view, very nice beds, & very, very clean, & I am VERY picky about hotel rooms being clean!! The pool is fantastic!! It's in walking distance to the mall, but you may want to drive, so don't have to carry all your bags back with you. :) Yes it had some con's: valet parking is the only parking & is expensive per day & tip can be a bit much. The TV had limited chanels if you wanted more you had to "buy" a package for $10.00, we ordered Nick for the kids & it only had 6 shows to watch over & over for 24 hours. The mini fridge only has a top shelf for your own drinks/food, its stocked if you want to pay for snacks. The bathroom is a little dated but how much time are you spending in there really? All in all it was a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Bajangirl41
Reviews.Content: Always stay at this hotel when I am in Miami. Short walk to Dadeland Mall, DSW, Target, CSW and Ross. Great place to stay for shopping. Cheesecake Factory located in Dadeland Mall, always a great place to eat. Service is excellent. Not for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Be Prepared to Pay for Everything....”
Reviews.Author: gerimsw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a long weekend and we enjoyed the price and the hotel...the valet service was very nice. However, when we arrived in our room, there was a mini-bar that was sensored. We are not drinkers so we always bring our own water and soda. It was a little complicated to have them de-code our refrigerator so that we could put our own drinks in there, but they still charged us at check out, but we did dispute it and they were accomodating. The other thing that was a surprise was the cost of our daily internet usage (approximately $9.50 per day). Usually hotels provide free internet service. I guess I'm used to staying at other places where small incidentals are included. All in all, it was a wonderful experience and get away.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: BobReh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night with a friend. The staff seemed unmotivated and like they'd want to get rid of us. The room was large and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kirbdo
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay, the rooms were nice and clean, the flat panel tvs are great, service in the resturant and bar area was also very friendly. Shopping is nearby along with some great resturants. The only thing I did not like about this hotel was the must valet park at $17 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Just a number”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl1972
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very overpriced (no value for money here) and the service was substandard. Unprofessional and uncaring. I expected a higher level of service from the Marriott brand. Isn't that what we are paying for? To be fair, the room was dated but clean and comfortable and the breakfast staff in the restaurant were very nice to us each morning. I cannot recommend this hotel however. No personalised service from the front desk team - we were just a number to them. Not good enough!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF ROOM CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: geohove
Reviews.Content: Whilst the staff at this hotel are invariably charming the whole experience depends on which room you stay in. Quite frankly Marriott should be ashamed of themselves! The rooms on the lower floors have simply not been redecorated or refurbed since at a rough guess the 1980's. They very much remind me of the 'norm' for a large scale corporate chain hotel in the late 80's/early' 90's. Drab burgundies/blankets/bed covers/ill-fitting curtains - you know the type! The majority of hotels have moved on. There really is NO excuse here - I have stayed in much better motels. HOWEVER the refurbished rooms are comfortable, well-appointed and nicely decorated. Almost like two different hotels under one roof!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as usual”
Reviews.Author: pamal100
Reviews.Content: We always stay at this hotel, by choice when we visit the Univ. of Miami. Great service, nice rooms, very comfortable beds. If you want to stay in very nice surroundings and just feel good- not going for the lesser bargain without the extra cushiness of the hotel, this is the place to stay. In other cities for quick travel we stay at the always dependable Marriott Courtyards- everywhere. But when in S. Miami- we enjoy ourselves here. And I am staying again next month. Right across from the grocery store, Dadeland Mall, and many restaurants and shops. And join the autoclub AAA for a few dollars- you get GREAT discount on most every hotel, rental cars and attractions. Can't beat it for the best price.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stanparsons
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as it was convenient for the airport and business meeting but found it average compared to the normal standards of marriott hotels. The room was clean but i found the bed very unconfortable and thought the bathroom layout very akward with the toilet and shower inside but the sink outside of the bathroom... I would not return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of my Favorite Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Canes428
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for visits to the University of Miami - so close by, and very luxurious. There is a rooftop pool that I find myself thinking about quite often! Walking distance to many different restaurants, a large mall, and the metro stop. Parking can be an issue since it is in tight quarters with condos and another Marriott (courtyard) across the street. Next to a grocery store as well. I have seen rates at $89.00 and go up to $350+...depends on what time of the school year it is!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: fernh
Reviews.Content: We had a free night from Marriott and chose a hotel that was within driving distance since we were only staying one night. The front desk staff were very friendly and upgraded us to a concierge floor after noting that my husband was an elite member. The lobby is very stark and could use some more furniture but it was spotless. For security purposes you have to use your room card in the elevator to be able to get to your floor. Our room on the 21st floor had a great view. Comfy bed, nice furniture. Large flat screen tv on the wall. Basically we had 3 complaints with the room. The fan from the heater/air conditioner was very very loud. It wasn't broken, just loud. We turned it off at night so we could sleep. The 2nd complaint was something we had not run into for a long time at all of the Marriotts we've stayed at. The right side of the dresser contained a small fridge. It was loaded with stuff, sodas, candy, etc., that you would be charged for if you moved it. So if you wanted to buy some food/drink and store it, there was very little room. The final complaint was one that drives me crazy. The $5 bottle of water on the dresser that you could buy. There were also 2 wine glasses and a bottle of wine. We thought, hey, nice. Not so fast, the note on the bottle said that it cost $16. I really don't like hotels trying to sell me food and drink while I'm in my room. The valet parking does cost $17/day. Yes it would be nice to park it ourselves but we didn't really have a problem. Would I stay here again? Sure. It's a very nice, clean, modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A-Class Service”
Reviews.Author: chickenfranks
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel and in all essence it was a high class well given service stay. From the bellboys to the front desk to the maids and other staff members they are high class people. I was on the concierge level and the service was exceptional. Quick maid service. Prompt assistance when you needed it. One area i truly enjoyed was the restaurant where the waiters and waitresses have their country name displayed along with their names. That to me showed embracing warmth and openness because not only did we meet many people of differing nationalities, but felt at home. The shuttle service was great. You are given the schedule and get picked up and dropped off to the varying malls and airport. No one is ever left behind. If you want a week of fun this is the place to go. Oh and it is right near the train station. What more can you want?

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Valet...”
Reviews.Author: startours
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel about 8 times a year, we decided to write this review because we visited last month and still saw the same system being run. The Valet system is forced on you, you can't do anything else. It is Extremely Expensive and is charged to your bill daily, you have NO choice. When you call down you sometimes have to wait an HOUR to get your car, I mean come on, we spent most of our week waiting for our car. They expect tips everytime you drop your car off and pick it up, which is a lot for us since we are in and out. They were not nice either. They made us stop coming to our rooms trying to avoid them. We even thought of parking at the Publix parking lot, but its kinda far. The worst thing was once we got our car back and the B.O. (Body Odor) was HORRIBLE. I mean HORRIBLE, we got the car washed and shampooed and it did not help. We reported it and they said that they can't do anything about that. I mean come on. This destroyed our trip. We don't visit this hotel again although we are in Miami about 8 times a year. We will not visit until they get the Valet system changed or removed. We used to park ourselves and loved the hotel. We now stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: LondonForestlondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. The room and bathroom was very clean and cleaned on both days. It is also at a convenient location. Walking distance to Dadeland mall, Ross, Old Navy, DSW, Best buy, Bed and Bath, and restaurants. They provide shuttle service to and from the AirPort, and Mall. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy1219
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 very nice days at the Marriott Dadeland while in town for a wedding. The hotel is very pretty and we found our room quiet and comfortable. The staff were attentive but not intrusive. My only concern prior to our stay was the required valet parking. Unlike some previous reviewers we had no problems with it taking too long to get our car. We called before leaving our room and the car was either there when we arrived or arrived within a few minutes. It is in a great location in an up-and-coming part of Miami. We were within walking distance of the Dadeland Mall, Publix, Panera, and Shorty's Barbecue (a Miami institution). But this is not a spot for you if you want to be near the water. With taxes and parking it was a bit pricey but I would stay there again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robby97
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Stayed here for a business meeting. The bed and pillows were comfortable,staff are friendly, they went above and beyond when my brother got food poisoning. they reimbursed us for the food, reccommended doctors and hospitals. They even went to the pharmacy for over the counter medication for us. We really appreciated their help. Dadeland Mall is within walking distance and Publix is across the street. The hotel will collect you from the airport and take you back. They will also take you to the mall. Metro railroad track is in back of hotel to take you around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: mripoll
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week for a business meeting and everything from the food, the rooms, the employees were beyond excellent. Definitely exceeded my expectations. The Dadeland Mall is within walking distance. There is a train in the back of the hotel that will take you anywhere in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: exec1
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel I was greeted by the bellman and front desk. I had made the reservation and do to some inconveniences was guarenteed an upgrade from the front desk manager. When I arrived the girl at the front desk knew nothing about this and the manager refused to speak to me. I was told he did not know who I was. Upon check out I saw this same manager, when I approached him to speak to him he was very obtuse and would not consider anything that I had to say. I would not stay at this hotel again. It seems the higher level staff is very self absorded and in it for themselves. This does not represent Marriott standards. It is also an older hotel and not in a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jvreeland
Reviews.Content: I traveled to a client site that was about 3 or 4 blocks from this hotel. The hotel was very nice. There was a small glitch in their computer system when I arrived so they gave me a free comp drink from the bar while I waited. The rooms were normal Marriott rooms, nothing really special. There is a Publix Grocery store directly across the street from the hotel which was easy to grab a few snacks and drinks for the evenings. One major issue I had with the hotel was the length of time it took to get my car out of Valet. I called down each morning or evening to get my car about 5 or 10 minutes before I came down and I still ended up waiting a good 15 minutes. This turned out to be a major pain every day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: LauraK2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dadeland Marriott for 3 nights. I had 3 very busy days, including driving (this hotel was centrally located for me). The front desk staff were EXCELLENT - helpful to the point of giving me their phone number to call if I thought I might need driving directions after being on the road! They were also helpful to me by making photocopies, printing out maps, and giving me area information. The room was clean and I really appreciated the "non-smoking" rule - it was nice to leave my room and still not smell smoke, anywhere in the hotel. I ate room service after getting back in quite late each night and it was delivered in a timely manner. The first night was quite good, the second OK and the third not so great! They must change chefs nightly! The third night I ordered halibut and instead received swordfish prepared as the halibut should have been. Not only was the fish completely different (like ordering prime rib but receiving pork chops), the preparation was suited to halibut, not swordfish! Even so, I was so glad I stayed here as the location, proximity to highways, cleanliness, and helpfulness of the staff were all so important, top-notch, and appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “shambles !!!”
Reviews.Author: DianePerthshire
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel at the end of September. When we arrived the check-in clerk asked "2 double doubles?" to which we replied yes (there was my husband myself and two children aged 9 and 7 ) He then said "oh we don't have any you'll have to have a rollaway bed put in your room". When the bed arrived it was of a single size even though we had been assured it was a double size and would fit two. When we asked repeatedly for another room or another bed we were told "we are full tonight ". It took several phone calls down to reception and then a visit to them to finally get another rollaway bed put in the room. The Assistant Manager okayed this even though it was "against regulations to do so !!!!" We had been travelling for 21 hours at this point and just wanted to get the children and ourselves to bed but we couldn' t believe the attitude of the Assistant Manager and reported this to Royal Caribbean as soon as we embarked the ship - to date( 5 weeks later) we still have not had a reply to our complaint. the hotel blamed Royal Caribbean for only telling them they needed a room the day before but Royal Caribbean claim this is rubbish. My advice? make sure you get the InterContinental Bayside as it is much nicer and right next to where "Liberty of the Seas" is docked !! Incidentally this happened to another Scottish couple travelling with their 21 year old daughter. Even she ended up in a rollaway bed !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Service & Good City Views”
Reviews.Author: StuartSussex
Reviews.Content: I would agree with most review points from a previous reviewer (jjstives). This is an excellent hotel with excellent facilities and service. The comparison with a Marriott in York, England I stayed in 2 weeks previously is very noticeable in service and hotel standards, with this being a far superior experience. Location is also good for the Dadeland Mall a few blocks away, a restaurant at the end of the road on the way to the mall (Chilis) and the end stop of the Metrorail just next to the hotel. Getting to South Beach on Metrorail you go to Government Centre, then take the frequent S bus to South Beach. It did seem only just safe on a Sunday morning - so I would think of taking a taxi on an evening, if by yourself or if any doubts. From MIA Airport, the price is about $40 including tip for a taxi. I stayed here with business & I was told by locals that everywhere is reasonably safe within 20 minutes around. The closest-by area to avoid seemed to be Grand Avenue in Coconut Grove. But decide for yourselves on this. Overall, a good stop, but mainly if you want to be out of town or are doing business here. Ask for a room facing the City if you can as the views were incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Disapppointed”
Reviews.Author: pilot2643
Reviews.Content: I booked this directly on the Marriott site. Upon arrival, I was informed by the desk clerk that I had been "upgraded" to the concierge level. I thought "nice". Went up to room, where I found the concierge desk three feet from my door. The entrance to the room is right off the elevator in the area where the concierge sits and they serve food. Not even down a hallway. What followed was loud groups of people coming up to get their refreshments and talk. Very loud talk. And every time my wife and I exited the room, all heads swung toward our room as we opened the door. Very uncomfortable feeling, although the bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was microscopic, and room for only one person at a time. For 200+ per night, I don't think this property is worth it and I would not stay there again. The hotel looks very tired and is obviously an aging property. The bell staff was very nice though. You have to use them to park your car (17.00 per day extra) because there is no self parking other than a garage next door.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: mk407
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for 3 nights. Way overpriced ($200+/night during my stay); there is no self-parking - only valet in the parking garage was available which is $17-19/night. Hotel staff were nice and helpful. Hotel exterior & interior looks nice. My room was on the 14th floor; had a nice view facing downtown Miami. Internet access in room was not free; had to ask for a refridgerator, which was old and made a weird noise. Room was a little older (carpet & walls), but clean. Bathroom area was okay. Location was good and near a number of restaurants; also, the Dadeland mall is down the street. Alot of construction (new condos & high rises) in the area was going on during my stay. Did not visit any of the amenities. Would not stay here again because of the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Advance warning”
Reviews.Author: mediaminx
Reviews.Content: My family booked three rooms at the Marriott Dadeland. We were part of a wedding party of over 40 out-of-town guests and the bride & groom had chosen this hotel due to proximity of the wedding. The check-in process was chaotic and we did not get into our rooms until 2 hours after normal check-in. I had booked the rooms 2 months in advance and the hotel knew about this wedding at least 8 months in advance. Furthermore, I had called 24 hours before to check on the rooms and request early check-in due to the hectic wedding rehearsal schedule that day. The excuse given for the late check-in was that we wanted our rooms on the same floor. I think that is was poor planning and prioritizing on their part. To add insult to injury, one of my family members was charged $250 for smoking in their. room. We were not told about this fee when I called to make reservations and requested smoking rooms; when we checked in; not posted on their website. However, there are tiny cards with fine print in the rooms to let you know! Ironically, two other members of our party smoked in their rooms and they were not charged the fee. So...smokers beware of the Marriott chain in Florida! By the way, I did look up the Florida Non-smooking Law and the penalty is $100. I guess Marriott needs the extra revenue to "recover" the room. In addition, you can hear other guests using the bathrooms from other rooms. Upon checking out, I was given the wrong keys to the car by the valet. From a world traveller and Miami native, I recommend that you stay away from this hotel! Try the Hampton Inn nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A Heavenly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: plechadores
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this Marriott and I booked my stay for six nights. I am very, very satisfied and even more surprised that this Marriott is very nice. Their staff is very professional and courteous. The service is amazingly great and the food at the restaurant is very good. They have an amazing Sunday Brunch that will entice all cultures.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experiance”
Reviews.Author: nbaker7952
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, good looking and well kept, unfortunately the area it is in although it seems safe is undergoing alot of construction at the moment and is clearly going to be something better in years to come. There is a mall that you can see from the hotel but it is a 10 minute walk across a busy street unless you take the complimentary shuttle. Problem with the shuttle it does'nt come back and get you so you will probably have to walk at some point. The mall has a bit of everything and a great food hall which was beneficial as a single traveller. The hotel offers free internet access in the lobby which makes life alot easier for people like me that use the net frequently. The rooms were very clean and of a good standard, the staff were freindly and helpful however, I lost my passport on the metro mover in downtown Miami and although the staff assisted me in getting a few numbers for embassies etc they failed on the basics of where to get photos done etc (even though there was one next door!). The hotel is well connected, free shuttle from the airport and a train station attached to the hotel whcih can get you downtown in 20 minutes. Felt quite safe here and would probably use the hotel again as first choice, a very welcome choice from staying Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Get the yummy fruit basket dessert via room service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel frequently when I travel for business. Some of the rooms are particularly unique...there is a suite on the top floor (the Presidential suite, maybe?) that is like a small apartment..it has a pull down bed, which is interesting. Some of the rooms on 7 (pool level) are nice if you are a smoker...you have a sliding glass door out to the pool area with a small private iron table..you can eat breakfast out there which is very pleasant..although poolside rooms can sometimes feel a bit humid and chloriney. The service is excellent, and the food from the restaurant is great. I recommend ordering room service, especially the fruit basket dessert which is served in a lovely, crunchy praline basket. Delicious! If you do want to get out of the hotel, there is a wonderful Italian restaurant within walking distance on US1 (Dixie Highway. Ask the concierge..they'll know.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: canelaw99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married here in March, 2004, and I felt like such a VIP the whole week leading up to the wedding. All of the staff knew who I was, and anything that we needed was taken care of immediately. My parents stayed here most of that week, and will definitely stay there again. The service is amazing at this hotel. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Dadeland Mall is near”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well. the rooms where ok, but you could hear your next door neighbor visit the bathroom. The Staff was ok. Not too friendly but just ok. the GOOD things about this place is, that DADELAND MALL is near. A nice MALL for great shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while visiting the University of Miami. A first class hotel. Not exactly near the hot spots of miami but the Dadeland Mall across the street was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track but not bad”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: Had to be here on business and although this is a quiet place, the service in both the lounge and the restaurant was very good. The reception staff was excellent. Room was clean and neat with no surprises. Food in restaurant is very good.

HotelInfo.Name: Miami Marriott Dadeland
HotelInfo.Address: 9090 S. Dadeland Boulevard, Miami, FL 33156
